body.raw: ## Mechanics Refer to [MythicTrap — Kurog Grimtotem](https://www.mythictrap.com/en/vault/kurog) for detailed visuals and animations of the mechanics. Moving Kurog into a different quadrant of the room causes him to attune himself to the quadrant's altar. Doing so inflicts `36,049` damage to the raid and applies [Primal Break](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374864) making the raid 300% more vulnerable to this damage, stacking. Kurog attacks his current target inflicting `324,438` damage to players in a frontal cone and knocking them back. Players that are hit suffer `28,839` physical damage every second for 35 seconds. If Kurog is in the middle of the room, aka not in one of the quadrants, he will deal `7,210` elemental damage to the raid every 0.5 seconds, stacking. This should never be triggered. At 100 energy Kurog enters his no-touchy shell and makes us kill his children. The third time Kurog reaches 100 energy he gains all altar abilities simultaneously and deals `7,210` elemental damage to the raid every 0.5 seconds, stacking. This is an enrage mechanic that is hopefully not seen. ### Elemental Altars ### Altar Mechanics Each altar has a "dominance" mechanic causing him to pulse `33,645` damage of the corresponding element type to the raid every 4 seconds. Triggering an altar, killing an intermission add associated with an altar, and Kurog casting his ultimate ability at 100 energy each add 10% increased damage to this mechanic. Kurog hurls magma at several players, dealing `60,081` fire damage to them and causing a large fire circle to spawn under them that deals `108,146` fire damage every second to players within it. Players should bait this mechanic away from the raid as the circle lasts a long time. Kurog radiates fire lines dealing `180,243` fire damage to players hit by them. Several players are infused with fire, causing them to leave a fire swirly in their path every 1 second for 5 seconds. Each swirly explodes after 2 seconds dealing `447,962` fire damage to players hit. This is a typical bombardment-style mechanic where the player should keep moving to avoid the swirly and also avoid placing it under other players. ### Intermission — Blazing Fiend The raid burns for `2,403` fire damage every second while the Blazing Fiend lives, stacking. Magma pools form at random locations that inflict `108,146` damage when stood in. Adds will spawn from the magma pools, targeting random players with an interruptable cast that deals `76,094` fire damage. ### Altar Mechanics Each altar has a "dominance" mechanic causing him to pulse `33,645` damage of the corresponding element type to the raid every 4 seconds. Triggering an altar, killing an intermission add associated with an altar, and Kurog casting his ultimate ability at 100 energy each add 10% increased damage to this mechanic. Kurog debuffs all players with [Biting Chill](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=373678) causing them to take `12,016` frost damage every second for 10 seconds. Kurog knocks players in melee back and summons orbs every 2 seconds for 4 seconds that travel in lines away from him. Players hit take `180,243` frost damage and are stunned for 6 seconds, though dispellable. A chunk of ice is hurled at two players, inflicting `740,974` frost damage split evenly among all players in the impact location. Getting hit gives a player 1 stack of [Frost Bite](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=372514). Reaching 2 stacks causes the player to be [Frozen Solid](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=372517), stunning the player and receiving a large DoT for 10 seconds. The vulnerability implies two separate soaking groups. ### Intermission — Frozen Destroyer The raid shivers for `2,403` frost damage every second while the Frozen Destroyer lives, stacking. The Frozen Destroyer unleashes a frost nova that inflicts `72,097` frost damage to all players and an additional `16,823` frost damage every 2 seconds for 20 seconds and reducing movement speed by 10%, stacking. This is interruptable. Winds form around the Frozen Destroyer dealing `96,129` frost damage every second to players farther than 10 yards away. However, players within 10 yards take `24,279` frost damage every second. ### Altar Mechanics Each altar has a "dominance" mechanic causing him to pulse `33,645` damage of the corresponding element type to the raid every 4 seconds. Triggering an altar, killing an intermission add associated with an altar, and Kurog casting his ultimate ability at 100 energy each add 10% increased damage to this mechanic. A sequence of concentric earthen rings erupts from the ground, inflicting `288,390` nature damage to players struck. Originates from melee and travels outwards. Several players are debuffed with a healing absorb for `379,713`. Several `Earth Breaker` adds erupt from the ground, dealing `216,292` nature damage to players in the eruption. These adds must be tanked and should be stunned and focused down as they cause [Skeletal Fractures](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=377780), a stacking 6% physical vulnerability to the tank. ### Intermission — Tectonic Crusher The raid burns for `2,403` nature damage every second while the Tectonic Crusher lives, stacking. Melee attacks debuff the target with a stacking 3% physical damage vulnerability that is removed after attacking a new target. Several players are infused with volatile earth, erupting to deal `168,227` nature damage to nearby players after 5 seconds within 10 yards. This is a collective spread mechanic. After the effect expires, [Violent Upheavel](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374430) is triggered at the location dealing `216,292` nature damage within 10 yards and knocking players away. ### Altar Mechanics Each altar has a "dominance" mechanic causing him to pulse `33,645` damage of the corresponding element type to the raid every 4 seconds. Triggering an altar, killing an intermission add associated with an altar, and Kurog casting his ultimate ability at 100 energy each add 10% increased damage to this mechanic. Kurog charges several players with electricity for 5 seconds. Upon expiration, charged players inflict `168,227` nature damage to players within 12 yards. This is a large circle that players need to spread out for. Several players are affected with a debuff that, on expiration, increases nature damage taken by 30% and inflicts `12,016` nature damage every 1 second to the closest player for 8 seconds. The goal is to avoid two players with [Lightning Crash](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=373487) spreading their debuff to each other as this will increase their stacks and likely kill them both. Find a friend without the debuff and shock them. Several swirlies spawn around the altar that inflicts `84,113` nature damage to players in their impact. If one of these fails to hit a player then the entire raid will take `218,461` nature damage. ### Intermission — Thundering Ravager The raid suffers `2,403` nature damage every second while the Thundering Ravager lives, stacking. The Thundering Ravager vanishes and teleports behind a random player to unleash [Lethal Current](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391696) `40,855` nature damage every second for 6 seconds around the player. ## Mythic Changes Kurog will now summon an elemental in phase 1 corresponding to his active altar, turning this into a 2-target cleave fight. - These new elementals share a frontal ability flavored by their element — [Flame Smite](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=393309), [Frost Smite](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=393297), [Earth Smite](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391268), and [Storm Smite](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=393429). Each hit deals `256,977` fire, frost, or nature damage with a unique secondary effect. - The flame one lobs fire on the ground nearby. - The frost one slows the tank (or anyone else hit). - The earth one applies a large healing absorb to the tank (or anyone else hit). - The lightning one causes the tank (or anyone else hit) to become electrified, dealing massive damage to any players within 12 yards of them for 5 seconds. - They also have 1-2 other abilities: - **Flamewrought Eradicator** casts [Raging Inferno](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391555), converting any [Magma Pools](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374554) Kurog created into Raging Infernos. Infernos last for 15 seconds and can be soaked by players, dealing `54,608` fire damage every second and consuming part of the magma pool. If the inferno expires without being fully consumed a _Smoldering Hellion_ add is summoned, which casts things and is just generally annoying. - **Frostwrought Dominator** will mimic Kurog and cast [Frigid Torrent](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391019) when Kurog casts it for double the icy-ball dodging goodness. The Dominator also has a persistent aura, [Icy Tempest](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391272), requiring players to be within 10 yards of at least 2 other players lest they become [Frozen Solid](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=372517) for 10 seconds. - **Earthwrought Smasher** casts [Erupting Bedrock](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=395893), the rippling ground dodging mechanic, the same as Kurog's just now more often I suppose. - **Stormwrought Despoiler** casts [Orb Lightning](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374620), requiring players to chase down and soak orbs giving the player a light, 10 minute DoT or it explodes, dealing `289,100` nature damage to the raid. However, with our strategy we will not be summoning this add (intentionally, anyway). The intermission adds now bring mechanics from phase 1 with them. - **Blazing Fiend** now also casts [Searing Carnage](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391499), the flame dance mechanic. - **Frozen Destroyer** now also casts [Absolute Zero](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=372456), the dual-meteor soaking mechanic. - **Tectonic Crusher** now also casts [Seismic Rupture](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374705/seismic-rupture), spawning ground circles that erupt into the little adds. - **Thundering Ravager** now also casts [Thunder Strike](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374217/thunder-strike), the lightning swirls that must be soaked in phase 1. We have not seen this mechanic in heroic lately, but in mythic, these swirls will be in the central circle of the room, instead of randomly in a quadrant. ## Mythic Strategy The elementals summoned from activating an altar have a lot of health and don't despawn when Kurog enters the intermission, which would lead to a wipe if one made it there. This means each phase 1 must consist of only a single altar. However, there is a major complication where Kurog picks the intermission elementals based on altar stacks: - The 2 highest stack counts are the elements he chooses. - _If one of the 2 highest stacks is tied with a third or fourth, those other elements can be chosen randomly._ - Elementals in the intermission can only be fought once, so the second intermission is set based on the first. For example, if we sat in fire till the first intermission he would have 30 fire stacks and 1 stack of all other elements. The first highest is "30" fire, so he picks a fire elemental. Next he sees "1" tied with all other elements, so he picks another element at random. This has a 2 in 3 chance of causing an instant wipe. To combat this, we will get Kurog to 30 stacks then wiggle him to the storm altar at approximately 97 energy, giving us a stack of storm but not staying in the altar long enough to spawn the add. This sets the altar count to approximately 30 fire, 2 storm, 1 frost, 1 earth, guaranteeing we get the fire and lightning elemental in the intermission. The downside to this strategy is there is a very tight window where it's appropriate to get Kurog into the storm altar quadrant. Do it too early and we get an add that wipes us, too late and we have a 2 in 3 chance of getting a lethal intermission elemental combo and wiping. With all of that said, the fight will follow this order: 1. **Phase 1** — Fire altar, dip into storm altar for the last tick. 2. **Intermission** — Fire and lightning elemental intermission. We leave Kurog in the middle of the room for 2-3 seconds to desync the future elementals to make earth and frost dodging mechanics easier. 3. **Phase 1** — Earth altar until intermission. We don't need to touch frost as we've already killed the other two elementals. 4. **Intermission** — Earth and frost elemental intermission. 5. **Phase 1** — Frost altar until enrage. ### Phase 1 Ranged will bait on the perimeter markers for [Magma Burst](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=382563) pools and stack with melee on for the [Searing Carnage](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374022) dance. The fight is scripted so there is a dance after every 2 pool baits, with the sequence labeled in the picture. 1. — Ranged baiting pools 2. — Ranged baiting pools 3. — Everyone stacking for dance Everyone moves according to their dance WeakAura, left if you don't have the debuff and right if you do. Players moving with the debuff will need to stutter-step to avoid running out of room. 4. — Ranged baiting pools 5. — Ranged baiting pools 6. — Everyone stacking for dance. The add needs to be dead by now `~1:30`. 7. — Ranged baiting pools. The elemental should be dead by now, so the pools aren't converted into the soaking mechanic. Soaking is assigned by immunities or tankier specializations, e.g. ``` {square} Rogue {triangle} Mage {moon} Monk {diamond} Hunter ``` ### Intermission 1 This intermission will feature fire and lightning elementals with the lightning elemental being kill priority. The raid will start on to bait the [Searing Carnage](https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374022) dance. When the dance starts everyone ignores their WeakAura and moves as a group into the middle of the room. Afterward, everyone will remain stacked in melee for baiting dances unless lightning soaks are about to come out in which case the 6 ranged players will disengage from the group to soak them. There are caveats to the dance movements, but in general, your priority is to move together as a group, but if you're separated do not cut off the group. While the lightning elemental is alive healers should be in melee range of this or the other elemental as it jumps to healers and we don't want it teleporting out of range. However, the tank should be the only person inside of the lightning elemental's hitbox as it will then pick them for the "get out of the raid" mechanic. ## Weakauras - [Searing Carnage Direction Arrow (grimtotem)](https://wago.io/SxHOCR1WK) provides directional arrows for the fire dance. Players without the debuff get a red arrow that has them go left, and players with the debuff get a green arrow that has them go right. - [Kurog Grimtotem - Dance](https://wago.io/4saOA8G4D) is a countdown bar for the phase 1 fire dance. It has ticks on the bar to indicate when the fire lands, allowing stutter-stepping. - **Tanks** [NGAndersson - Kurog Phase Timing](https://wago.io/SxHOCR1WK) provides a visual for the tanks to know when to move the boss to the lightning altar just before the intermission. ## Video

`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Kurog will now summon an elemental in phase 1 corresponding to his active altar, turning this into a 2-target cleave fight."}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.ul,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:["These new elementals share a frontal ability flavored by their element \u2014 ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=393309",children:"Flame Smite"}),", ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=393297",children:"Frost Smite"}),", ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391268",children:"Earth Smite"}),", and ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=393429",children:"Storm Smite"}),". Each hit deals ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"256,977"})," fire, frost, or nature damage with a unique secondary effect.",`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.ul,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"The flame one lobs fire on the ground nearby."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"The frost one slows the tank (or anyone else hit)."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"The earth one applies a large healing absorb to the tank (or anyone else hit)."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"The lightning one causes the tank (or anyone else hit) to become electrified, dealing massive damage to any players within 12 yards of them for 5 seconds."}),`
`]}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:["They also have 1-2 other abilities:",`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.ul,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Flamewrought Eradicator"})," casts ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391555",children:"Raging Inferno"}),", converting any ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374554",children:"Magma Pools"})," Kurog created into Raging Infernos. Infernos last for 15 seconds and can be soaked by players, dealing ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"54,608"})," fire damage every second and consuming part of the magma pool. If the inferno expires without being fully consumed a ",(0,e.jsx)(n.em,{children:"Smoldering Hellion"})," add is summoned, which casts things and is just generally annoying."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Frostwrought Dominator"})," will mimic Kurog and cast ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391019",children:"Frigid Torrent"})," when Kurog casts it for double the icy-ball dodging goodness. The Dominator also has a persistent aura, ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=391272",children:"Icy Tempest"}),", requiring players to be within 10 yards of at least 2 other players lest they become ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=372517",children:"Frozen Solid"})," for 10 seconds."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Earthwrought Smasher"})," casts ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=395893",children:"Erupting Bedrock"}),", the rippling ground dodging mechanic, the same as Kurog's just now more often I suppose."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Stormwrought Despoiler"})," casts ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374620",children:"Orb Lightning"}),", requiring players to chase down and soak orbs giving the player a light, 10 minute DoT or it explodes, dealing ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"289,100"})," nature damage to the raid. However, with our strategy we will not be summoning this add (intentionally, anyway)."]}),`
`]}),`
`]}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"The intermission adds now bring mechanics from phase 1 with them."}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.ul,{children:[`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Frozen Destroyer"})," now also casts ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=372456",children:"Absolute Zero"}),", the dual-meteor soaking mechanic."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Tectonic Crusher"})," now also casts ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374705/seismic-rupture",children:"Seismic Rupture"}),", spawning ground circles that erupt into the little adds."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Thundering Ravager"})," now also casts ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374217/thunder-strike",children:"Thunder Strike"}),", the lightning swirls that must be soaked in phase 1. We have not seen this mechanic in heroic lately, but in mythic, these swirls will be in the central circle of the room, instead of randomly in a quadrant."]}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.h2,{children:"Mythic Strategy"}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"The elementals summoned from activating an altar have a lot of health and don't despawn when Kurog enters the intermission, which would lead to a wipe if one made it there. This means each phase 1 must consist of only a single altar. However, there is a major complication where Kurog picks the intermission elementals based on altar stacks:"}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.ul,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"The 2 highest stack counts are the elements he chooses."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:(0,e.jsx)(n.em,{children:"If one of the 2 highest stacks is tied with a third or fourth, those other elements can be chosen randomly."})}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.li,{children:"Elementals in the intermission can only be fought once, so the second intermission is set based on the first."}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:'For example, if we sat in fire till the first intermission he would have 30 fire stacks and 1 stack of all other elements. The first highest is "30" fire, so he picks a fire elemental. Next he sees "1" tied with all other elements, so he picks another element at random. This has a 2 in 3 chance of causing an instant wipe. To combat this, we will get Kurog to 30 stacks then wiggle him to the storm altar at approximately 97 energy, giving us a stack of storm but not staying in the altar long enough to spawn the add. This sets the altar count to approximately 30 fire, 2 storm, 1 frost, 1 earth, guaranteeing we get the fire and lightning elemental in the intermission.'}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"The downside to this strategy is there is a very tight window where it's appropriate to get Kurog into the storm altar quadrant. Do it too early and we get an add that wipes us, too late and we have a 2 in 3 chance of getting a lethal intermission elemental combo and wiping."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"With all of that said, the fight will follow this order:"}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.ol,{children:[`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Phase 1"})," \u2014 Fire altar, dip into storm altar for the last tick."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Intermission"})," \u2014 Fire and lightning elemental intermission. We leave Kurog in the middle of the room for 2-3 seconds to desync the future elementals to make earth and frost dodging mechanics easier."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Phase 1"})," \u2014 Earth altar until intermission. We don't need to touch frost as we've already killed the other two elementals."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Intermission"})," \u2014 Earth and frost elemental intermission."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.li,{children:[(0,e.jsx)(n.strong,{children:"Phase 1"})," \u2014 Frost altar until enrage."]}),`
`]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.h3,{children:"Phase 1"}),`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["This intermission will feature fire and lightning elementals with the lightning elemental being kill priority. The raid will start on ",(0,e.jsx)(r,{type:"triangle"})," to bait the ",(0,e.jsx)(n.a,{href:"https://www.wowhead.com/spell=374022",children:`Searing
Carnage`})," dance. When the dance starts everyone ignores their WeakAura and moves as a group into the middle of the room."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:"Afterward, everyone will remain stacked in melee for baiting dances unless lightning soaks are about to come out in which case the 6 ranged players will disengage from the group to soak them. There are caveats to the dance movements, but in general, your priority is to move together as a group, but if you're separated do not cut off the group."}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(d,{type:"warning",children:(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:`While the lightning elemental is alive healers should be in melee range of this or the other elemental as it jumps to healers and we don't want it teleporting out of range.
